channel.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
channel.description:
[center][size=25pt][b]Scarduku v1.5[/b][/size][/center]
By r!ch!e
This took me hours to make....It is basically Sudoku ... but on scar!
[size=18pt]Features::[/size]
Answere Checking 3 puzzles - (Easy, Moderate, Hard)
[size=18pt]Future Features::[/size]
[ul][li]Timer:[/li][/ul] (!!!! Need help with these. Causing me errors. If you can help the please post!!!) Best Time Current Time
[ul][li] Even More Challenges[/li][/ul]
[ul][li] Better Answere Checking! [/li][/ul]
[size=18pt]SideNotes::[/size] © Copyright 2006 r!ch!e. All rights reserved
Thank you Cruel for making it much easier to code in puzzles :D Thank you Ron, and Weibs for helping me and pointing out errors, improvements, etc.
Script is attatched
Have Fun! :D

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @r_ch_e r!ch!e
item.description:
@r_ch_e wrote:

yh it’s based off of Cruels because it is ALOT easier to code in the puzzles, and the amount of coding is less. v1 was huge but v1.5 was smaller because there was less code.

I’m working on a better check answere system. I’ll probably, like you said, change it to display errors.

I need to know if the form is too small.

And I need help with the timers. I’m trying to display. ‘00.00.00’ then get it to raise to ‘00.00.01’. then to ‘00.00.02’ etc., but im getting the error, ‘Could Not Call On Proc’.

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Next version looks better, did you base it off of cruels version of yours?

Change the check answers button to show if you have any wrong. cause if you put in the same number for every box, then all the boxes with the right number will become red, and it will be very easy to cheat in the game.

So if you press on check answers, and you find an error, just display there is an error in this box or something. just an idea.

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @cruel cruel
item.description:
@cruel wrote:

Here, I Cruel1zed your script.
Knocked it down to 145 lines.
And also made it easier to add more puzzles. You just have to add it as an array. First half of the array being the initial state (0 for blanks) and the second half being the puzzle answer.

[code]program Sudoku;
type TPuzzle = array of Byte;
var
frmDesign : TForm;
Edits: array[0…80] of TEdit;
Exitbtn, CheckAnswerebtn, SetupChallengebtn : TButton;
Puzzle1: TPuzzle;

procedure LoadPuzzle(puz:TPuzzle);
var i: Integer;
begin
for i:= 0 to 80 do
with Edits[i] do begin
Font.Color:= clBlack;
Text:= ‘’;
ReadOnly:= False;
if puz[i] <> 0 then begin
Font.Color:= clRed;
Text:= IntToStr(puz[i]);
ReadOnly:= True;
end;
end;
end;

procedure CheckPuzzle(puz:TPuzzle);
var i: Integer;
begin
for i:= 0 to 80 do
if Edits[i].Text = IntToStr(puz[81+i]) then begin
Edits[i].Font.Color:= clRed;
Edits[i].ReadOnly:= True;
end;
end;

procedure SetupChallengeClick(sender: TObject);
begin
LoadPuzzle(Puzzle1);
end;

procedure ExitClick(sender: TObject);
begin
frmDesign.ModalResult:= mrOk;
end;

procedure CheckAnswereClick(sender: TObject);
begin
CheckPuzzle(Puzzle1);
end;

procedure frmDesignPaint(Sender: TObject);
begin
with frmDesign.Canvas do begin
Rectangle(63,1,64,176);
Rectangle(122,1,123,176);
Rectangle(2,60,184,61);
Rectangle(2,117,184,118);
end;
end;

procedure AddButton(btn:TButton; event:TNotifyEvent; title:String; y:Integer);
begin
btn:= TButton.Create(frmDesign);
with btn do begin
Parent:= frmDesign;
OnClick:= event;
SetBounds(200,y,96,25);
Hint:= title;
Caption:= title;
ParentShowHint:= False;
ShowHint:= True;
end;
end;

procedure InitForm;
var i,j: Integer;
begin
frmDesign:= CreateForm;
with frmDesign do begin
SetBounds(250,114,310,210);
Caption := ‘Sudoku V1…By r!ch!e’;
OnPaint:= @frmDesignPaint;
end;
for i:= 0 to 80 do begin
Edits[i]:= TEdit.Create(frmDesign);
with Edits[i] do begin
MaxLength:= 1;
Parent:= frmDesign;
AutoSize:= False;
j:= Round(i/9);
if (i/9) < j then j:= j-1;
SetBounds(5+(i Mod 9)20, 5+j19, 17, 17);
end;
end;
AddButton(SetupChallengebtn, @SetupChallengeClick, ‘Setup Challenge!’, 20);
AddButton(CheckAnswerebtn, @CheckAnswereClick, ‘Check Answeres!’, 50);
AddButton(Exitbtn, @ExitClick, ‘Exit’, 80);
end;

procedure SafeInitForm;
var V: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘InitForm’, v);
end;

procedure ShowFormModal;
begin
frmDesign.ShowModal;
end;

procedure SafeShowFormModal;
var V: TVariantArray;
begin
setarraylength(V, 0);
ThreadSafeCall(‘ShowFormModal’, v);
end;

procedure SetSelfWindowState(state: TWindowState);
begin
GetSelf.WindowState:= state;
end;

procedure SafeSetSelfWindowState(state: TWindowState);
var V: TVariantArray;
begin
SetArrayLength(V, 1);
V[0] := state;
ThreadSafeCall(‘SetSelfWindowState’, V);
end;

begin
Puzzle1:= [0,7,0,0,6,0,0,2,0,0,0,3,2,9,7,5,0,0,0,0,6,5,0,4,3,0,0, //Puzzle
0,6,8,0,0,0,7,1,0,1,0,7,0,0,0,9,0,5,0,9,5,0,0,0,2,8,0,
0,0,4,8,0,2,1,0,0,0,0,1,3,5,6,4,0,0,0,5,0,0,1,0,0,3,0,
5,7,9,1,6,3,8,2,4,8,4,3,2,9,7,5,6,1,2,1,6,5,8,4,3,9,7, //Answer
4,6,8,9,2,5,7,1,3,1,2,7,6,3,8,9,4,5,3,9,5,7,4,1,2,8,6,
6,3,4,8,7,2,1,5,9,9,8,1,3,5,6,4,7,2,7,5,2,4,1,9,6,3,8];
ClearDebug;
SafeSetSelfWindowState(wsMinimized);
SafeInitForm;
SafeShowFormModal;
SafeSetSelfWindowState(wsNormal);
FreeForm(frmDesign);
end.[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Weibs:

Oh, I thought the dimensions referred to how many arrays there were: X and Y = 2 dimensions, X, Y, and Z = 3 dimensions ( 3D ).

yeah you’re probably right.

[quote=“r!ch!e, post:3, topic:39024”]thnx ron

The reason they get bigger is because of the font size…I’ll change that.
The boxes in the middle are supposed to be blank

Ahh. I see what you mean. Ill change that aswell.

That does sound harder, and i dont quite understand what you mean. Could you explain in more detail?

Thanks again :D[/quote]

Hope to see the next version with more games. And wait, why are the middle boxes supposed to be blank?

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

Oh, I thought the dimensions referred to how many arrays there were: X and Y = 2 dimensions, X, Y, and Z = 3 dimensions ( 3D ).

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

1 dimension for each row. There are 9 rows. So for 1 row you would have.

SomeArray[0][0] = first row,first box
SomeArray[0][1] = first row,second box

SomeArray[5][0] = sixth row,first box
SomeArray[5][1] = sixth row,second box

etc.

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @Weibs Weibs
item.description:
@Weibs wrote:

I don’t think it would be a 9-dimensional array, would it? This is my take on it:

See, you’d set up the array like this:

Spaces := Array of Array of TEdit;

Then, the numbers on the left side ( take away one, because you’re dealing with arrays ) is the array index of the first Array, and the numbers on top ( again, minus one ) is the array index of the second array.

So to access that upper left corner box, you’d use this:

Spaces[0][0];

Its like a table. Get it? If you need any more help, just ask.

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @r_ch_e r!ch!e
item.description:
@r_ch_e wrote:

[quote=“Ron, post:2, topic:39024”]This is amazing work! Nice job!

You might want to change the edit height values after you click on “Setup Challenge” because the new edit values are much bigger than the other ones. Why is that?

When you click on Setup Challenge, none of the boxes in the middle are filled. They are completely blank.

Seems to be only 1 challenge? Boooo lol.

I can fill in text boxes with more than 1 character. You forgot to set Edit.Maxlength := 1.

Check Answers doesn’t seem to actually check answers for me. I filled in every box with 4, and when I hit check answers, all the boxes that should have 4 in it became red and there was nothing from the script saying there is more than one 4 in each section or anything.

Edit: And for extra fun, you can make a 9 dimensional array of TEdit lol for the 9 rows. It would make coding future versions of the script easier, it just doesn’t sound easier.

Nice script man. Hope it becomes more dynamic in the future.

~Ron[/quote]

thnx ron

The reason they get bigger is because of the font size…I’ll change that.
The boxes in the middle are supposed to be blank

Ahh. I see what you mean. Ill change that aswell.

That does sound harder, and i dont quite understand what you mean. Could you explain in more detail?

Thanks again

Read full topic

item.title: Scarduku v1.5 by r!ch!e
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

This is amazing work! Nice job!

You might want to change the edit height values after you click on “Setup Challenge” because the new edit values are much bigger than the other ones. Why is that?

When you click on Setup Challenge, none of the boxes in the middle are filled. They are completely blank.

Seems to be only 1 challenge? Boooo lol.

I can fill in text boxes with more than 1 character. You forgot to set Edit.Maxlength := 1.

Check Answers doesn’t seem to actually check answers for me. I filled in every box with 4, and when I hit check answers, all the boxes that should have 4 in it became red and there was nothing from the script saying there is more than one 4 in each section or anything.

Edit: And for extra fun, you can make a 9 dimensional array of TEdit lol for the 9 rows. It would make coding future versions of the script easier, it just doesn’t sound easier.

Nice script man. Hope it becomes more dynamic in the future.

~Ron

Read full topic
